intro: Shouyangshania scaposa, commonly known as the Yunnan scabious, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, clustered white or pale blue flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
